dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful blue-collar city approaching nightfall. Bridg Rivers. Churches. The working class poetry of the `Burgh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PADDY CONLON (60) exits the doors of a run-down church holding a 12-STEP BOOK. He is followed by a cluster of ot PEOPLE in the program and says his goodbyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy grips the steering wheel with labor-calloused hands drives over the P.J. McArdle Bridge and up a winding hill listens to "MOBY DICK" on tape as the last piece of dayli bleeds away. With rosary beads swaying from his rear view Paddy turns and eases the Olds past row houses in a blue- collar neighborhood high above the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOMMY CONLON (28), hard miles on a handsome face, sits on stoop of an old row house in a wool watch cap and winter coat. A duffel bag is at his feet, a bottle of whiskey in brown bag in his hands. He reaches into his coat pocket, a handful of prescription PILLS, and stares off into the approaching night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy pulls up to the curb in front of the house, clicks the tape, kills the engine, and climbs out of the car. As approaches the stairs, Paddy sees Tommy. Can't believe hi eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy gives a drunken, crooked smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just passing through. Figured why not have a belt with the old man. 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father and son look at each other. It's obvious it's been long, long time. Tommy takes a bemused look down at the c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (patting car hood) Yeah, she's hanging in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you always did take good care of her. Paddy Conlon. Man of priorities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy grins uncomfortably. Lets the remark go and climbs stairs as Tommy reaches into his duffel bag and produces fresh BOTTLE of Jameson. He offers it to Paddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a little something for ya. Mom always said never go anywhere empty handed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She did. But that's not for me anymore, Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You change brands?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy shakes his head. Tommy looks at him. Paddy Conlon n drinking? What gives?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, let's go inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy pats his son on the back and heads for the door as confused Tommy follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy and Tommy walk through the front door. The house is clean, yet all the furnishings are from the late 1970s. T stands in the den and looks around, breathing the old pla in, as Paddy makes his way into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like what you've done with the place. 3.

dialogues.speaker: PADDY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Appreciate that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of glasses CLINKING in the kitchen as Tommy tak off his watch cap and begins to look around his old home. glances down at a BIBLE on a table beside a weathered Bar lounge chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's not much of a woman's touch around here.

dialogues.speaker: PADDY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: No more women for me, Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Must be hard to find a girl who can take a punch nowadays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy takes another swig from his bottle and looks at a series of old PHOTOGRAPHS lining the walls as Paddy walks into the room carrying a coffee pot and saucers on an old wicker tray. Tommy looks at him, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee? You haven't seen a guy in 14 years and you're not gonna have a drink with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, I'm off it. I'm coming up on a thousand days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, just one drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy shrugs. Takes another pull from his bottle and turn back to the photos. He takes them in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy's eyes are drawn to another picture, likely taken a mall photography studio, of a MAN AND WOMAN (late 20s) PO WITH A YOUNG GIRL (2). The man looks like the second boy the other photos. His brother BRENDAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a school teacher down in Philly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy's face registers surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember Tess? They've got two beautiful little girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy turns back to the photos and looks at another one o the woman. Obviously his MOTHER. He puts it down, glances the bible, then stares hard at Paddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you found God, huh? That's awesome. Mom kept calling for him, but he wasn't around. I guess Jesus was down at the mill forgiving all the drunks. Who knew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy sips his coffee. Says nothing. Tommy keeps pressing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you gonna ask about her, or you just gonna sit there all sober?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you know? What do you know? Do you know it wasn't enough just to drive west to get away from you? When we hit the water we drove north, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I got sober I hired a man to find you. 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking a swig) Is that one of the 12 steps? Or does a guy like you get 24?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did your guy tell you what you needed to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just that your mother died in Tacoma. And you were in the Marines. That was all. That was enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's too bad. You could've gotten some good details.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy plops himself into a recliner. Glances at the coffe table, where a stack of classic books on tape sits. CRIME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could've heard about her coughing up blood in a shit box with no heat. Having me rub her down with holy water, because she didn't have no insurance. All the while waiting for your pal Jesus to save her. Did your man tell you that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to know you're sorry, Pop. Goes a long way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy chokes up. Tommy looks at him. Closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I liked you better when you were a drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An overwhelmed Paddy sips his coffee and looks at Tommy, is fading. The pills are kicking in. He tries to open his eyes, but it's no use, and after a few moments he's out. 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy glances down, where some pills have fallen out of Tommy's pocket and scattered on the rug. He watches his s Relieved and heartbroken at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chaotic birthday party in the back yard of a middle-cla home in the suburbs of Philly. A CLUSTER OF 5-YEAR OLDS r about, some whacking at a pinata hanging from a tree, som whizzing down a large blow-up slide, some getting their f painted by a make-up artist dressed like a GYPSY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TESS CONLON (29) bounces around the yard, multi-tasking l a champion and filming the proceedings with a VIDEO CAMER She trains the camera on BRENDAN CONLON (30), who sits in lawn chair in a scarf, hat, and women's make-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm not sure, but I think Daddy is now a princess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess laughs. Brendan looks at her with a "Help me out her expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Em, you want to open your presents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The make-over ends abruptly at the mention of "presents." Emily, little sister in tow, runs over to a table filled gifts as PARENTS and CHILDREN gather around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan gets out of the lawn chair and follows Tess over the gift table. Amidst all the presents is one BOX, cover in pink wrapping paper, that is far larger than the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off pink box) This an awfully big box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's her birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess turns the video camera toward Brendan again. He coul look more ridiculous. And he obviously didn't clear the g with his wife. He grins at her as she lowers the camera. 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but that's why you call it a budget. You set it, and you don't budge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan smiles in his make-up. Kisses his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The remnants of the birthday party lay strewn across the lawn. Tess, in a cocktail waitress outfit, says goodbye t her MOM and the kids, who play on the swing set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks toward the garage and enters to find Brendan pressing free weights on an old bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan continues to lift as Tess rushes in and tosses a of garbage in the bin. A deep CUT, hidden earlier by the up, is visible on his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey babe, I'm late. Mom's saying goodbye to the girls. She's gotta get on the road. They've been fed. They just need a bath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you get them down at a reasonable time tonight? They're exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan kisses Tess. Looks at her outfit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the rest of that skirt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Babe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, if any guys give you a hassle in that joint tonight you give me a call, okay? 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off his cut) Yeah. Just like you gave me a call when those Temple frat boys decided to smash up your face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, most nights I sit on the stool and grade papers, but every now and then I need some action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, well wait up for me tonight. I'll see what I can do about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess smiles flirtatiously and and heads for the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promises, promises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big, old-school warehouse, where a handful of GUYS whal away at MMA punching dummies and roll around on sweat- saturated mats. Sun slants through a dirty, industrial skylight. A no frills kind of gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the front counter, FENROY (20s) rolls hand wraps a watches ESPN's "MMA LIVE" on a laptop.

dialogues.speaker: JON ANIK, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: And we return here on MMA Live, Jon Anik alongside billionaire fight promoter J.J. Riley. The Tapout crew is also here. Punk and Skrape are in the building. Now J.J., what led to this project that is redefining Mixed Martial Arts here in the States?

dialogues.speaker: J.J. RILEY, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Well, Mixed Martial Arts is a sport that I've always been incredibly passionate about. As for where the idea for Sparta came from, I've always kind of dug the Grand Prix format, so I tracked these guys down to help me out. 9.

dialogues.speaker: PUNKASS, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: When J.J. came to us he said he wanted to create the Super Bowl of Mixed Martial Arts.

dialogues.speaker: SKRAPE, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: And he decided to put up the five million dollar purse, too.

dialogues.speaker: JON ANIK, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Well, there you have it. It shall be done. Hedge fund king J.J. Riley, going from the lion's den of Wall Street to the cage, promoting the biggest winner-take-all tournament in MMA history. Sparta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Fenroy watches them talk about the upcoming Sparta tournament, Tommy walks into the gym, surveys the room wi curiosity, and approaches the front desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzy still own this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know no Fitzy. Colt Boyd owns this gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenroy goes back to his computer. Tommy stands there. Not a Sparta POSTER on the wall reading: "THE WAR ON THE SHOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you with something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it work here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty five a month with locker. We're open at 7, lights out at 11. You wanna join?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenroy grabs a pencil and an index card and puts them on counter in front of Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your name and contact info on the card. 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan stands in a classroom, surrounded by high school STUDENTS wearing safety goggles and raising cain. A block wood sits wedged in a vice, and a student, TITO, stands o it with a Louisville slugger in his hands as his classmat CHEER him on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa whoa whoa! There's a lesson in this too, OK? Listen up. So we have a body at rest, and you have the bat which needs--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acceleration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acceleration, right. If you have enough acceleration, you have might have a chance to break the body at rest. OK. Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan, sleeves rolled up and a bemused look on his face watches as Tito brings the bat down on the wood. As it CR in half, the other students cheer wildly. Tito smiles and leans the bat against a blackboard with "NEWTON'S 2nd LAW MOTION" printed on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There we go. Alright Tito, well done. Remind not to mess with you. Sit down everybody. Dial it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Tito high-fives his way back through the group, things settle down and the kids take their seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, have we got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A room full of affirmatives, with the cocky voice of NASH skinny white kid in a Flyers jersey, standing out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Force equals mass times acceleration. We got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. The third law--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black student, STEPHON, looks up from his desk. 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many laws this dude got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dude? The dude has three. Newton the dude says that for every action, there's an equal and opposite reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan looks toward the classroom door, where two red-an white clad CHEERLEADERS are peering in, then walks over t KC, a blonde cheerleader seated in his class. She is work a Blackberry and doesn't notice him approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For example, if KC does not stop the action of sending texts in class...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan stands directly in front of her desk. She quickly shoves the Blackberry under a stack of books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and tell her posse outside to beat it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and shoos away the two cheerleaders peering in t window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...then my reaction might be to send her down to Principal Zito's office. Thus setting our world back in proper balance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. C, I put it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class busts on KC as Brendan walks back to his desk a sits on top of it. It's clear from the vibe in the room t he's a very popular teacher. Then the BELL rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, before you go, I have your tests from last week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenroy sits at the front desk and looks at his computer. Watches "MMA LIVE" and another feature on the big upcomin Sparta tournament. 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy, wearing a wife beater and old gray sweats, works a and eyeballs an ENTOURAGE that surrounds a ring. Inside, heavily-muscled FIGHTER with a mohawk, MAD DOG GRIMES (30 is putting a beating on his SPARRING PARTNER. The obsequi nature of the entourage makes it clear that Mad Dog is somebody important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the ring, the sparring partner takes a vicious spinnin back fist to the chin, goes down in a heap, and doesn't g up. COLT BOYD (40s), clearly in charge, throws up his han as Mad Dog laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you find these girls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colt climbs into the ring and looks at the fallen fighter Glances at Mad Dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a tournament coming up. You gonna kill every guy in the `Burgh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenroy. Get me some ice. And call that Puerto Rican kid, the one that fights outa the Bottoms. If he's here in 20 minutes, he gets 200 bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, I'll fight him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colt turns around and looks at Tommy. As does Mad Dog, wh smiles down at him from inside the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me a favor guy, go back to your bag. We don't need anybody else getting hurt. G'head. Take a walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy walks back to his bag. Mad Dog smiles. Looks at Tom outfit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo Rock, what happened? You leave Mick and Paulie at home today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy stops. Walks back to the ring as Fenroy approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His phone's disconnected. 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then go through the list. Get me Joe Bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I'm saying is if you need somebody to help you, I'm happy to keep your boy warm for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colt looks at Mad Dog. What do you think? The Mohawked fighter looks at Tommy. Shrugs. It's his funeral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever fought before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colt studies Tommy. Sees he's serious. Gives in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy sign a waiver?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get tuned up in here, it's on you, Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, no problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colt Boyd waves Tommy into the ring. Mad Dog's entourage starts whispering amongst themselves. Snickering at what in wait for Tommy as the fallen sparring partner is helpe out of the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TRAINER tapes Tommy's hands and gives him some MMA glov He slips them on, then at the sound of a BUZZER he starts moving toward Mad Dog, who smirks at Tommy's aggression a then starts circling him. Tommy nails him with a front ki to the chest. Grimes staggers back and shakes it off. 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna be a hero? Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crouches down, gets serious. He throws a right. Blocke leg kick. Blocked. Tommy snaps his head with a jab. Then does it again. And again. Then he DECKS HIM with a hard right, sending Mad Dog to the canvas to the shock of his entourage and Colt Boyd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenroy looks up from his post and walks over to the ring. Within moments everyone in the gym stops what they're doi and watches as Tommy grabs the back of Mad Dog's head, ha it down, and launches knee after knee into his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy starts throwing Mad Dog around like a rag doll, striking him with vicious punches and kicks, as Fenroy pu out his CELL PHONE and starts filming the action. As Colt Boyd screams at Mad Dog to cover up, Tommy shoves him aga the ropes and blasts away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy continues to pound. It's a full-fledged beating goi on in there. Finally, he crushes Mad Dog with a vicious l hook and sends him sprawling through the ropes, UNCONSCIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SILENCE in the gym. What the hell just happened here? The entourage rushes to Mad Dog's aid, but he's out cold. Col Boyd looks on in disbelief as Tommy walks across the ring approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You owe me two hundred bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan sits in a chair across from loan officer DAN TAYL (40s). They're mid-meeting and going over documents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the new appraisal figure, and this is how it effects the monthly. As you can see, that puts you upside down on your mortgage. That's the problem. It's the country that did the assessment, not the bank. So, the numbers are what they are, Mr. Conlon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan. 15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The numbers are what they are, Brendan. I mean, you're a Math teacher, you can appreciate that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I teach Physics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Physics. OK. But the bank has got to go by the new appraisal figures. According to these figures, you're upside down on your mortgage--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said that three times already. I get that. But I'm asking you if there's something else you can do. Not the bank, you. Can you shift things around, restructure--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you've already refinanced twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you advised us to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I presented you with that option. It was your choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm also showing you netted a substantial payout with the refi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had that conversation. I was paying medical bills. Is that in your file?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taylor looks at Brendan. Takes him a second to remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right. Sorry. Your daughter's...kidney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heart, right. (off stack of files on desk) Lot of stories. 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So my option is I've got no options? You're not even gonna try to help me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am trying, Brendan. Look, I can get you 90 days to get even--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 90 days is not enough. My wife and I have three jobs between us and that doesn't cut it. So, what do you suggest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me ask you a question: have you considered bankruptcy? It's a viable option. There's no shame in it these days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not how I do things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then you're looking at foreclosure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan gets up and storms out of the office.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Utter domination by Tommy Conlon, the undefeated freshman from Pittsburgh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy sits in front of the TV and watches an old VIDEO TA of a wrestling tournament. The bottom of the screen reads 1994 PA STATE WRESTLING FINALS. CONLON VS. SPEERY.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: ...the prodigy has yet to yield a single point in the entire tournament. It's just unprecedented. 17.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Tommy trained by his father since the age of five.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: You're talking about Paddy Conlon.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: The controversial Paddy Conlon.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Say what you will about the methods of the former Marine, but he's led his son to six straight junior Olympic titles, and now just moments away from a high school state championship. And there it is! Wow!

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: There's just no limit to what the future holds for this kid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Paddy watches, the DOORBELL RINGS. He makes his way to door as the tape continues to play.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Tommy told me that he's chasing the record of Theogenes, apparently a mythical Greek fighter said to be unbeaten in over 1400 bouts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy opens the door to find Colt Boyd standing on the st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doin,' sir? I'm looking for Tommy Riordan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy registers the name "Riordan."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy Riordan? My name's Colt Boyd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What business you got with Tommy? 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None yet. That's why I'm here. I manage fighters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colt looks at Paddy. Jams his hands in his pockets. He's obviously waiting for an invite inside. It doesn't come.

dialogues.speaker: COLT BOYD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tommy's been working out at my gym. He put a beating on the number one middleweight contender in the world today. I want to know more about the guy. Maybe help him out. I have a lot of contacts, Mr. Riordan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conlon. Name's Conlon. And anything you want to know about Tommy, you gotta ask him yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just looking for some general information here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said, anything you want to know about Tommy, you gotta ask him yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't mean to interrupt your night. He put this address down when he signed up at the gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't live here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy closes the door on a frustrated Colt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan drives down the road on the outskirts of town and talks on his cell.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Listen kiddo, I need you put Mommy back on, OK? I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. I'm just pulling in. Huh? Oh, they've got this open mic night thing. Should be a quiet one. Sleep well. You too. Bye. 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan pulls into the parking lot of the local strip clu white TENT is set up outside, and the parking lot is overflowing with cars. Something big going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aluminum bleachers are set up around a ring, where TWO AMATEUR FIGHTERS go at it under a bank of sodium lights. Hundreds of rowdy LOCALS swill beer and BOO lustily when action slows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE MOORE (20s), a FIGHTER sporting sleeves of demonic i paces in his corner as a cluster of BIKERS cheer him on f ringside. An ANNOUNCER walks to the center of the ring wi cordless microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time for our next contest! Introducing first, fighting out of the red corner, from Ripley, West Virginia, please welcome Mike "The Mutilator" Moore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some hollers from the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in the blue corner. He fights out of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Please welcome "Irish" Brendan Conlon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lo and behold, there's a shirtless Brendan standing in th corner of the ring wearing a pair of shorts. On his right shoulder, an elaborate TATTOO of the CONLON FAMILY CREST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This bout is scheduled for three five-minute rounds, and when the action begins your referee is Mr. Rick Fike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The REFEREE enters the ring and stands between Brendan an Mike Moore. 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fighters to the center! I want you to obey my commands at all times. If you have no questions, touch gloves, back up, and wait for my signal. Come out fighting!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan reaches out to touch gloves with Mike Moore, but opponent snubs him and storms back to his corner. He mean business. Brendan, looking less sure of himself, retreats his corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fighters, are you ready? Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bikers raise hell as the BELL sounds. Moore comes out bombing. Brendan dodges a couple of wild haymakers, then caught in the side of the head with a right hand. He stum back into the ropes and Moore presses into him, swatting him with his huge hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan absorbs the blows, ducks down, grabs Moore by the legs, lifts him, and dumps him on the mat with a resoundi THUD. Obviously bull strong and with tremendous punching skills, Brendan sits on his opponent's chest and starts raining down shots, banging and banging, pulverizing his and body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a full on ass-whooping going on in there until final mercifully, the referee stops the butchery amidst a mixtu of CHEERS from the crowd and BOOS from the bikers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A winded Brendan walks to his corner, touches the side of head, wipes a small amount of blood on his shorts, and cl out of the ring, where a PROMOTER approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice fight. Two more wins and you take home the bacon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bedroom door opens and Brendan creeps through the roo and into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark, except for the moonlight glowing through the window. An exhausted Brendan takes off his shirt and begi washing his badly SWOLLEN FACE. Then the door opens, and shuffles in. 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey babe. How was work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan doesn't answer. Tess slowly wakes up. As she does she gets a look at his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. What happened? You said it was going to be a slow night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess studies his face. Brendan looks at her. Reaches into pocket and hands her $500 in cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not bouncing at a club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean you're not bouncing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him. Looks at the money. Puts it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been lying to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went in to apply. They were only paying nine bucks an hour. Then I saw a sign for this other thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess can't believe what she's hearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're putting us out of the house in three months, we're running out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then they'll put us out of the house in three months. I'd rather go back to the old apartment than see you in the back of an ambulance again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we agreed that we weren't going to raise our children in a family where their father gets beat up for a living. 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not giving up the house. This is our home. We're not going

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess reaches up and touches his battered face. Calms hers down. Embraces her husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll figure it out. But this is what we're not going back to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A steady rain tumbles down over an old-school diner in th shadow of the railroad tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy sits in a booth and takes a sip of coffee. Judging the spent sugar packets and the half-eaten club sandwich, he's been there a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door swings open and Tommy enters wearing his w cap and sweats. He makes his way over to the booth and pl himself down. It's clear something's on his mind but he doesn't say anything. Finally, Paddy engages him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna start fighting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't play babe in the woods with me. I know that guy from the gym came to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colt Boyd? I didn't tell him anything, Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wouldn't be sitting here now if you did. 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy grabs a fry off Paddy's plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Look. There's this tournament. A big tournament. Top sixteen middleweights in the world. Single elimination. Winner take all for a lot of money. I'm gonna do that. But if I'm doin' it, then I'm gonna need a trainer. Now that much you were good at. (off Paddy grinning) No, no, no. This doesn't mean anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy tries to tether it down, but he's happy. Tommy look him sternly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious. We train. That's it. I don't wanna hear a word about anything but training, you understand? You wanna tell your war stories, you can take `em down to the VFW. You can take `em to a meeting, or church, or wherever the hell it is you go nowadays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Colt Boyd?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him? I told him I don't train with people I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, the devil you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The devil you know is better than the devil you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy looks at him. Grins for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chasing Theogenes. It'll be kinda like old times. 24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just told you, this doesn't mean anything. You get that through your skull right now or I'm walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy calmly sips his coffee, then leans in on Tommy with stern look. The old lion's got a few teeth left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Alright. But you get something through your skull, too. You called me. So don't go threatening to walk every five minutes. And since this is about training, you dump whatever it is you need to dump as far as those pills are concerned. I don't want to see `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy gives him a hard look, but the old man doesn't shy away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact, hand `em over right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know they're on you, Tommy. You sounded like a goddamn maraca coming through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy considers, then reaches into his pocket and slides bottles across the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not gonna do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you came through that door it was chhh-chhh-chhh. (holding up 3 fingers) Three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy looks at him. Fishes another bottle out of his pock and flips it on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off French fries) And another thing, you don't eat crap like this. This is for losers and old men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're gonna have to bunk up. If we're gonna do this right, you gotta stay at the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I watch your diet, we follow the old regimen. You copy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men stare at each other. Tommy looks furious, but doesn't get up. A silent, tenuous agreement is reached.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan, his face BRUISED badly from the night before, wa down the hallway toward his classroom. STUDENTS watch him he passes and whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class is filled with the kind of BUZZING that can onl rise off a major rumor. Tito, Nash, KC, and Stephon discu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brother said he was at the strip club and saw Mr. C fighting MMA---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's MMA?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mixed Martial Arts. Like, different styles of fighting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother's a liar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan enters the room. The kids look at him. Holy shit. It's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan puts his bag down on his desk and faces the class is not amused by the murmuring in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids pipe down. Then Tito speaks up. 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Mr. C. My brother was at the titty bar last night and said you was choking brothers out. What's up? Is it true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Mr. C. I mean, did you really work on some fools or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to tell us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Brendan can answer, he sees PRINCIPAL JOE ZITO (50 gesturing to him through the window of the classroom. Zit taps his watch and points. Come see me after class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zito, puffy faced, hair getting thinner by the hour, hang his phone as Brendan pokes his head in. Zito waves him in Eyeballs the marks on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, it's not as bad as it looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you being literal or figurative? Because literally it looks bad. And figuratively it looks even worse. The superintendent's coming by in a few minutes. So gimme a little help here, Brendan. Can you explain to me what the hell you were doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need the money, Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but we can't have this. This isn't moonlighting at Applebee's for Christ's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zito stands up and runs his hands across his head.

dialogues.speaker: JOE ZITO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit, Brendan. Leaving everything else aside, which we can't, are you out of your mind? You're gonna get yourself killed. I mean, you're a goddamn teacher.

dialogues.speaker: JOE ZITO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You've got no business in the ring with those animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I used to be one of those animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zito looks at Brendan. Puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fought for a living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess I forgot to put that down on my application.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zito sits back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm sorry, Joe. It's just--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, the school district's not going to tolerate school teachers cockfighting in strip clubs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the parking lot of a strip club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wherever it was, you can't be doing it, alright? I mean this is a serious--shit, he's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zito sees the SUPERINTENDENT enter the foyer outside his office. He's looking none too pleased.

dialogues.speaker: JOE ZITO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is a serious problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy hasn't been inside a school since 9-11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say yes, sir. And you say no, sir. And you say it'll never happen again, sir. And then we just pray to God he's in a good mood. 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan and Joe stand up. Zito can't tether down a slight grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan nods. Joe shakes his head. Impressed.

dialogues.speaker: JOE ZITO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sonofabitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan sits in a miniature playroom off the kid's bedroo putting glue on the leg of a TOY PIANO. Tess enters the bedroom, where the girls sleep, and leans into the playro They speak in whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls have an important piano recital in the morning. Got an equipment malfunction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're gonna review your case at the end of the semester, but until then you're suspended without pay. Joe gave me the number of his attorney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell are we gonna pay for an attorney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess crouches down and enters the tiny room. She sits on floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He talked to me for free. As a favor to Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was nice. 29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said there's no precedent for this. You'll be back by next semester.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next semester?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess sighs. They sit in silence. There are no easy soluti Finally, Brendan speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Tess. They have these smoker fights all over. There's one in Lancaster next week. There's two in Dover the week after. Wilmington. Camden. Baltimore. It could keep us afloat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna put yourself through this over and over, for five hundred bucks a pop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of them pay a little more than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would have had to bounce for a month to make what I made in two hours last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan looks at his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And these guys, they're not real fighters. They're just guys who have seen too much UFC on TV. If you have a better solution, I'm all ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess sits quietly. Knows they have limited options.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we gonna tell the girls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be fine. I'll just leave the house as usual, except now I'll be going to the gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other. No choice. This is the plan. 30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy climbs the stairs with a POSTER BOARD tucked under arm and a cup of coffee in his hands. He enters Tommy's r which is also a monument to the past. Old wrestling TROPH Steelers' posters, and an EMPTY SECOND BED that obviously once belonged to Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh the duck says quack and the cow says moo, and the old red rooster says cock-a-doodle-doo. Cock-a- doodle-doo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy places the cup of coffee on the night stand as Tomm stirs, then sits on the empty bed and unrolls the poster. It's yellowed with age and covered with a boy's handwriti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look what I found in that disaster of a basement. Whattya say we sit down and update this sometime? You can fill me in on how close you got to that record.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy says nothing. Not a nostalgic bone in his body. The dreams on that poster are long gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you continue wrestling after you left with your mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Tommy. Tell me something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'll tell ya something. You can take that thing back to where you found it. And you can leave the coffee in the pot. I can pour that myself. I can wake myself up, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy's stung but covers it amiably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Hurt my knees coming up and down those stairs anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee pot's on til 0-500, then I dump it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marine base camp in the middle of the Iraqi desert. Black HELICOPTERS floating in the sky. MARINES rushing about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARINES of various rank huddle around a computer screen, fired up about something they're watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn dude, that's brutal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LANCE CORPORAL MARK BRADFORD (20s) walks up to see what t commotion is all about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Mad Dog" Grimes gettin' tuned up by some dude in a gym in Pittsburgh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's "Mad Dog" Grimes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, Bradford. The stuff you don't know amazes me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god, did you see that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bradford stares at the screen, his eyes widening as the Marines raise hell about the footage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, rewind that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the Marines rewinds the video. Bradford looks at t image in disbelief, then races out of the tent. 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bradford hustles outside into the searing sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bradford enters a barracks, where Private "AV" SIMERS (20 plays cards with other MARINES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AV, I need to see the tape!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What tape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AV drops his cards, rushes to his bunk, pulls out a steel container loaded with VIDEOTAPES and sifts through it. Th are labeled by day and month. AV finds what he's looking loads it into the camera, and hits PLAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AV holds the "Pause" button down as Bradford looks at the screen in disbelief. It's definitely Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him. That's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a top MMA gym, FRANK CAMPANA (40s) works in a ring wit Brazilian superstar MARCO SANTOS (20s) and other FIGHTERS The sound of CLASSICAL MUSIC fills the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let the music sink in to you. This is Beethoven. Breathe. Breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Frank teaches, Brendan walks in the door. The great trainer notices him and walks over. 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I know you? I think I know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They embrace warmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long time, brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liking the place, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, brother. (off Brazilian fighter) You see this beast? Marco Santos? I'm training him for Sparta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazing, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two head for the offices at the back of the gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk into an office filled with PHOTOS of Frank in h fighting days. He was obviously somebody. The walls are a adorned with SPARTA posters. Frank reaches into a mini- fridge, pulling out a couple bottles of Vitamin water. He hands one to Brendan and motions for him to sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look good, brother. How're the girls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Good. I had another little one. Rosie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Johnny C. told me she was in the hospital for a bit. I was gonna call, but then time went by. I don't know. I'm a piece of shit. I should have called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Brendan. I'm sorry. 34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all good. She's good now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks at his old friend. Smiles warmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's great to see you, man. So everything's going good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Well, I've got a little problem. The guys at the bank want to take my house away. That's kind of why I came to see you, actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank considers what he's hearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got most of my dough tied up in this joint, but how much do you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't come here for a loan, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was hoping you'd train me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Train you for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to get back in the cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank starts smiling. Leans back in his seat. Then he see Brendan is not smiling with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just won an event the other night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, you won an event. (off bruised face) That's what this is. Let me guess, it was in a parking lot. DJ from the local radio station. Couple of ring card girls you wouldn't bang on a dare. Am I right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan smiles. 35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ish. Brendan. I love you. I do. But why would I train you? When you were in shape and on the right side of 30 you were barely a .500 fighter. You never listened to me. You never listened to anyone. These guys are animals. I mean, you're a teacher, right? What're you gonna do? You're gonna come down here for a couple days a week after detention? You're gonna skip out of the girl's volleyball game early?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got loads of time. Time's not an issue. The parking lot thing kinda got me suspended. I need to keep working the smokers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess know about this? (off Brendan's nod) Yeah? `Cause the last time you fought, I got read the riot act sitting in a hospital waiting room. You remember that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I was unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two friends share a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not gonna come down here with the two puppies, screaming at Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not gonna happen. Come on. Whattya say, Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I say? What am I gonna say to you? No? I mean, all my time is wrapped up with Marco. You come down, I'll throw you in the rotation, you spar with these guys, no problem. But I can't promise you much more than that, Brendan. 36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all I need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan stands up. Shakes Frank's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me know when you're coming down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm just gonna go get my stuff from the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan puts his dukes up and smiles as Frank shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan pulls into the driveway of his modest home, gets of his Camry, and looks to the street, where Paddy stands outside his Olds, leaning on the passenger door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan carries a gym bag and wears work out clothes. He' clearly not happy to see Paddy, who stands there, uncomfortable and heavy hearted in the light of the stree lamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Brendan. It's me, Pop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have some news for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something wrong with your hands?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy shakes his head, unsure what he means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there's nothing wrong with your hands then there's no reason for you not to phone. That's the deal. 37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I forgot--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phone or mail, Pop. Non negotiable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy holds his hands out, palms down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Brendan, have you ever seen my hands so steady? Have you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a thousand days. A thousand days sober today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's great, Pop. But it doesn't change anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean it doesn't change anything? Have a heart, Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy's words set Brendan off. A side of him we haven't s before emerges. He approaches his father fiercely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You listen to me. You take your have-a-heart bullshit and you run it down the road. Run it out on someone who doesn't know you like I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Brendan. I thought maybe we could break bread. Open some lines of communication.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got two lines of communication, the telephone and the post office. Just because you decide it's a special day, it doesn't make it one for me. I got a wife and kids inside and they're waiting for me, so I don't have time for whatever this is. 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you got a wife and kids in there. I got a grand-daughter I haven't seen in three years and another I haven't even ever met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is that, Pop? Why is that? Do you remember having anything to do with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy nods. Casts his eyes down in shame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That shit you pulled. Never again. And all the shit I saw growing up? That doesn't happen here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan looks at the reformed Paddy, a measure of sympath his face. Then he heads for the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he's halfway through the yard, Paddy calls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan stops in his tracks. He turns and looks at his Da

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in the `Burgh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy's in Pittsburgh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He came to see me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He came to see you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's over at the house. We're doing a little training at Fitzy's. Remember Fitzy's? It ain't Fitzy's anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan walks closer. Incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Tommy are training together? 39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy Conlon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riordan. He's using your mother's maiden name now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what her name is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you'd want to know he's back. That's why I drove all the way over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you came to break bread over a thousand days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan looks at him. Considers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he say if he wants to see me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't say much. He's just not that happy kid he was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, look at you. Mister inside man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Tommy training together like nothing ever happened. This is unbelievable. Now I know what you're really doing here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came to gloat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not come to gloat. I came to get my son back. 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there you go. You got your son back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking about you, Bren--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got your son back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan starts to walk away, then turns around again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, part of the reason I stuck around was `cause I thought I'd finally get you all to myself. But you didn't have any interest in training me. Tommy was the one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Brendan. I was a drunk. I mean, you know. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. You were always a front runner. You never had any interest in underdogs. But I was your son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are my son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you are. I'm just asking you to find just a little space in your heart to forgive me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Alright. I forgive you. But I do not trust you. Tell Tommy this is where I am if he wants to see me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. But they're not different things. You've gotta trust to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, Pop. 41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy looks toward the house, where Emily, Rosie, and Tes stand at the door. Paddy waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, is that Emily? Boy, she's grown, Brendan. Is that Rosie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan keeps walking. Opens his door to step inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, who is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just some nice old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan closes the door, leaving the heartbroken Paddy al in the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy, his hoodie drenched, jogs up the sidewalk and ente the gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenroy watches "MMA LIVE" on his computer as Tommy walks the door and heads into the gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huge news breaking here at ESPN. Koba is coming to America and will fight at Sparta. Universally considered to be the greatest pound for pound fighter that ever lived, the mighty, mythical Russian has never fought on U.S. soil in his legendary career...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mad Dog Grimes trains furiously under the watchful eye of Colt Boyd. When Colt sees Tommy approaching, he turns his attention away from Mad Dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy? Got some news for ya. I got you into Sparta. Took some doing, but I made it happen.. (off no reaction from Tommy) Thank you and 10 percent is customary. 42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy heads up the stairs toward the locker room without acknowledging Colt, though he does allow a small smile to crease his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy pulls a crumpled PIECE OF PAPER out of a beat-up wa and begins dumping change into an old pay phone on the wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More of a shack than a house. PILAR FERNANDEZ (20s), a pr but tired Mexican girl, watches a grainy TV with a six-ye old BOY and a four-year-old GIRL as the phone RINGS. The table it sits on has a FRAMED PICTURE of Tommy and anothe MARINE on it, their arms around each other in the Iraqi desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bueno?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pilar. It's Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy! Dios mio! I can't believe it! How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good good. How you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. You know me, Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was getting really worried about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're things? Kids are good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're good. Maria's getting so big. She looks more like Manny every day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's little man? 43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's good. He's a good kid, Tommy. Takes care of his sister. He's a great kid. Everyone's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Pilar, I haven't forgotten for one minute what I promised you. What I promised Manny. I've got an opportunity coming up to help you guys out. To take care of you guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you can do, Tommy. I know Manny would really appreciate it. You worry too much. It's OK. We're hanging in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy, hoodie up, runs in the darkness as Paddy's Olds tr behind him, the SOUND of "Moby Dick" playing in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank watches as a team of FIGHTERS races up a steep hill Marco is ahead of the pack, Brendan in the middle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy runs hard through an industrial area along the Allegheny River. The sky, the steel, the bridges, everything's hard and gray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bradford and other Marines watch "MMA LIVE" on a laptop.

dialogues.speaker: JON ANIK, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: With eight weeks left til Sparta, J.J. Riley and the TapOut crew take time out of their international press tour to join us.

dialogues.speaker: JON ANIK, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: J.J., we've never seen this kind of Grand Prix tournament in the country before. Tell us, why the unique format?

dialogues.speaker: J.J. RILEY, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Well, Jon, you know as well as anyone that in Mixed Martial Arts, anyone can beat anyone on a given night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan takes steady blows from an OPPONENT in another smoker, then turns the tables, slams his man down, and ch him out. His skills are improving.

dialogues.speaker: J.J. RILEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...but with this type of format, it's gonna be tough to deny who the champion is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In an expansive and grim scrap yard along the river bank, Tommy somehow manages to lift and flip old long-haul rig tires. They're roughly the size of hot tubs. His strength astonishing.

dialogues.speaker: J.J. RILEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You've got four fights in two nights, sixteen fighters down to one. Winners gonna be the last man standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone charging up the hill with Frank pushing them. Ma leads the charge again, but Brendan is gaining and a clos second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy runs across the bridge as Paddy follows behind in t Olds, right at his heels. The pace is relentless. 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess and the girls run up the stairs as ESPN plays on the in the den.

dialogues.speaker: JON ANIK, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Only five weeks left `til Sparta and the hype continues for the War on the Shore. Fourth of July weekend in Atlantic City and you know what that means: the great Koba, bringing his act stateside. Let me ask you about the other guys. What are they thinking entering a winner take all tournament against a guy that seemingly can't be beat?

dialogues.speaker: RASHOD EVANS, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: They're thinking five million dollars, and five million dollars is a lot of money, but they've gotta remember one thing: they're going against Koba. Mission impossible. Game over. Go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess comes back down the stairs and looks at the screen, concern on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank lets himself into the gym at the crack of dawn. Fin Brendan already there, training alone with ferocity and listening to classical music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy pounds on tires with a sledge hammer as Paddy exhor him on. It's a brutal regimen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenroy watches "MMA LIVE" on his computer. 46.

dialogues.speaker: JON ANIK, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: The `Pittsburgh Beatdown' has become one of the most watched videos on YouTube this year. Now joining us via satellite is the victim of the infamous incident, Mad Dog Grimes. Mad Dog, what is your response to all the hoopla surrounding the video and Tommy Riordan?

dialogues.speaker: MAD DOG, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: This guy's a nobody. It was just a sparring session. It is what it is, and he's gonna pay for it next month in Atlantic City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan works over another FIGHTER in a smoker. He looks fantastic and submits the guy with slick Jiu Jitsu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up the hill they race, Brendan now leading the way and Ma struggling to catch up with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy and Mad Dog work out, each jumping rope at blinding speed. They eyeball each other, the hate increasing.

dialogues.speaker: JON ANIK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: With Sparta now only two short weeks away, J.J. Riley and the TapOut crew returned to the U.S. after a world tour that saw them visit ten fighters in ten different countries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Marco and Brendan train, J.J. Riley, SkySkrape, and Punkass walk into the gym and warmly greet Frank. All obviously old friends. 47.

dialogues.speaker: JON ANIK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They stopped in Philadelphia today to check in on renowned trainer Frank Campana and top contender Marco Santos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy keeps running, Paddy in the Olds right behind him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You've gotta relax and stay calm in there. The cage is your home. You set the pace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan and Marco grapple. They're evenly matched. Frank looks on, impressed by Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You set the rhythm. Feel the Beethoven. Be smarter than him. More patient. Wait for him to make a mistake. And when he does, that's your moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan turns Marco and gets him in a knee bar. Marco has nowhere to go and is forced to TAP. Frank jumps in the ri all smiles, and slaps Brendan on the chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No he did not tap you! Physics teacher! That's the best in the world there, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy keeps pushing the giant tires until he finally reac the end of the yard. He's ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, Brendan, and group of other FIGHTERS stand at the bottom of the hill and tend to Marco Santos, who has just badly INJURED HIS KNEE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An AMBULANCE pulls in front of the ER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sorely dejected Frank walks through an underground park garage with Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna be OK? Wanna grab a bite?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. I'm gonna head home. I gotta call the boys and break the news. I'll call you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank heads off through the lot. Brendan reaches his car, stops, considers. Calls out to Frank while jogging toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach! Hey, I know this isn't a great time. And it's too bad about Marco. But what about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan looks hopefully at Frank, who shakes his head as begins to open the door of his `70 Ford Bronco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talking about Sparta? Brendan, please. You got a better chance of starting a boy band. I'll talk to you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a grand prix tournament. Which means anything can happen. You know that as well as I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks at him. Sees how serious Brendan is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll have to kill me to get me out of that cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm afraid of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, I need this. You're real tight with those guys. You call them, they'll listen to you. 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You realize what you're asking me to do here, Brendan? We go down to AC and you get tapped out in five seconds, how does that benefit either one of us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not gonna happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not gonna happen. Wish I had a nickel for every time I heard that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not gonna happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank breaks. Smiles. How can he say no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan grins and walks back toward his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love my coach!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan pulls a garbage bin down to the curb as Tess walk out of the house talking on a cordless PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: TESS, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Yeah, the girls are good. They're good. Yeah, you should. You've been spending so much time with Brendan these days it's like you're part of the family or something. Yeah, he's right here. (handing phone to Brendan) It's your boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Hey Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's unbelievable. I can't thank you enough. I don't know what to say. Alright, listen, I've gotta call you back. Alright, bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan hangs up the phone. Looks at Tess. 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in. I'm going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look of serious concern crosses Tess's face. She puts h hands on her hips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? So that's your decision? You decided? `Cause I really enjoyed that conversation we just had about making that decision together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan doesn't say anything. Knows she's right. And that he's about to get laid into.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me you were gonna fight guys that watched too much UFC. I saw that Koba dude on TV, and he's the guy they're watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a lot of money, Tess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a shit about the money, Brendan. I told you that. We're gonna end up cashing in your life insurance policy before we pick up that prize money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think I can do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you can get killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna get killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, you're not going to get killed. But can you promise me you're not going to get hurt? You're not gonna end up in the hospital? You're not gonna end up paralyzed? We'll have no prize money. No house. Payments for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess, I can promise you this: if I don't try, they're gonna take the house. How's that for a promise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response from Tess, who has tears in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I'm gonna go, OK? But I'd really love it if you'd be with me on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess looks at her husband. Wants to support him, but can'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna watch you fight again. I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get the girls breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess starts walking back toward the house. She marches up lawn without turning back, leaving Brendan, alone, in fro of his house. He looks at the toys strewn across the yard Surveys the neighborhood. He's going to Sparta.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Fourth of July weekend doesn't officially start until tomorrow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunlight pours down on the crowded beaches, hotels, and boardwalks of AC. Thousands of PEOPLE jam the outside of majestic Boardwalk Hall. It seems as if everyone on earth in town.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...but fight fans are already descending on Atlantic City for the Super Bowl of Mixed Martial Arts, Sparta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLBOARDS heralding the arrival of the SPARTA tournament everywhere. Ceremonial Fourth of July banners hang, cars Ocean Avenue, early FIREWORKS pop. The buzz is electric. greatest show on earth has hit the shore. 52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIMOUSINES pull up in front of the Boardwalk Hall rotunda "Mad Dog" Grimes, Orlando "Midnight" Le, Karl "The Dane" Kruller, and other fighters make their way down a long re carpet swarming with FANS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the middle of it all is J.J. Riley, greeting press and guests and running the show as the Tapout crew, Colt Boyd and others mill about and talk shop. Announcers BRYAN CAL (40s) and SAM SHERIDAN (30s) corral J.J. for an interview

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.J., you've made a fortune with your hedge funds, yet you turned your back on Wall Street and dedicated your life to making Sparta happen. Tell us, why is this tournament so important to you?

dialogues.speaker: J.J. RILEY
dialogues.text: Growing up, we all wanted to know who the toughest kid in the neighborhood was, right? I wanna know who the toughest man on the planet is. That's why I put this together, that's what all these people are here to see, and come Saturday night, that's what we're gonna find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, J.J. And here's something fans never thought they'd see: Koba is here! The legend arriving to fight on U.S. soil for the very first time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The great and mighty KOBA emerges from a white stretch li trailed by his ENTOURAGE of tough-looking RUSSIANS. FLASHBULBS pop. REPORTERS swarm. It looks like a movie premiere out there and Koba's the star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As WORKERS set up for the press conference and camera cre stake out their territory, Tommy and Paddy hug the corner the room and wait. Not in their element at all. Moments later, Brendan comes walking through the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he moves through the crowded room, Brendan and Tommy m eye contact. 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They haven't seen each other in 14 years, and judging by looks on their faces they certainly didn't expect to see other today. Paddy is just as shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan begins to inch toward Tommy, but is intercepted b Frank, who was caught up in the media storm outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
