dialogues.text: Hey. Where'd you go? You can't leave me like that. They wanna talk to you, not me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan looks past Frank. Tommy has risen and headed towa the exit, trailed by Paddy, who calls after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun descends over the boardwalks and hotels of Atlant City, and sinks into the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy sits on a couch thumbing through a Sparta program a looks proudly at a PICTURE of Brendan. He listen to "Moby Dick" on his headphones as a TV plays in the foreground.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE MOONEY, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: ...the only fighter missing from the event was dark horse entry Tommy Riordan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy notices the picture of Tommy. Puts down the program takes his headphones off.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE MOONEY, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Recent revelations that Riordan was not only a United States Marine but a hero in the Iraq War, has cast an even brighter spotlight on a fighter who seems to have come out of nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE MOONEY, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Lance Corporal Mark Bradford's web testimony to Riordan, who saved his life earlier this year in Iraq, is spreading like wildfire throughout the media.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy stares at the screen intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy!

dialogues.speaker: BRADFORD, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: ...the bridge just crumbled. The Amtrack was upside down. Water was coming in from everywhere. The water pressure was too much. We couldn't get the back hatch open.

dialogues.speaker: BRADFORD, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: We were all drowning, man. It was a death trap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy walks into the room from the door of an adjoining s and stares at the TV.

dialogues.speaker: BRADFORD, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: I couldn't have had more than another minute. Suddenly the back ramp gets ripped off, and there he was. Before I could get out and thank him, he was gone. He just vanished like a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy is dumbfounded and looks at Tommy, who glances at h and back at the TV before heading toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm takin' a walk.

dialogues.speaker: BRADFORD, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: You saved my life, brother. Anybody seeing this at Sparta, anybody out in Pittsburgh, reach out to Tommy Riordan. Tell him Mark said thank you. 55.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE MOONEY, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Footage taken from a helmet camera on the ground captured the heroic incident...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the phone RINGS. Paddy grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: PADDY, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan walks on the beach as the waves of the Atlantic O lap at the shoreline. Boats bob on the water. Stray bottl rockets trace through the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, the NEON LIGHTS of an amusement park fla and zip. Behind Brendan, the big casinos loom, advertisem for Sparta filling their BILLBOARDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan continues walking, then spots Tommy coming toward him. The brothers make eye contact. Stop. Then approach e other warily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been looking all over for you. How's it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking maybe we could grab a coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't drink coffee. Whattya want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to go sit down somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good right here. 56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan looks at Tommy. Sees how rigid he is. A long sile Finally Brendan cuts right to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, Tommy. How was I supposed to know I was never gonna see you guys again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were briefed. You had the information. You chose the old man and the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wasn't some girl. I married her. She's my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan reaches into his pocket and removes a recent Christmas PHOTO of Tess, Emily, and Rosie from his wallet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing Tommy the picture) That's Tess. And that's Emily and Rosie. They're your nieces, Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy glances at the photo impasssively and hands it back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you don't know them. Of course you don't know them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why am I looking at pictures of people I don't know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because that's my family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who are you exactly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm your brother, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were in the Corps?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I didn't know you were in the Corps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't in the Corps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you ain't no brother to me. My brother was in the Corps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, Tommy walks briskly away from Brendan and up t beach. His brother runs after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Tommy. I was a 16 year old kid. What the hell did I know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you know. Why don't you go ask your girlfriend about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's my wife, Tommy. So that's it? I stay with Tess and I never get to see you guys again? Not a single phone call? Nothing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response from Tommy. He's a wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, man, I don't understand this. You won't forgive me, but you'll forgive Pop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. He's just some old vet I train with. He means nothing to me. From what I hear he means nothing to you, either, so you got balls talking about forgiveness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's got nothing to do with forgiveness. I've got a family to protect. Everything I do is for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy smirks. Walks away again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I forgave Pop. Just like I forgave you and Mom. 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forgave us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not surprised you made the tournament, Brendan. You got some stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fell in love, Tommy. What the hell was I supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were supposed to stick to the plan. You were supposed to come with us. Mom needed you. I needed you. You were my big brother and you bailed on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The words hit Brendan hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm glad you stayed and everything worked out for you, Brendan. See, you leave, you get the opposite. You leave, you get to bury people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not the only one who suffered, Tommy. I didn't even know she was sick. I never even got the chance to say goodbye to my own mother. You had no right to keep that from me! That was not your decision to make!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? You walk around with your pictures in your wallet and you're all, I forgive you, I forgive Pop. I forgive everyone. But you know what? You're full of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy and Brendan are right in each other's faces. Standi on the knife's edge of violence. They hold the stare down a few long seconds, like two fighters about to go to war. 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we done, Brendan? Are we finished?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy and Brendan look at each other with burning intensi Too much baggage and both too much and nothing left to sa Finally, Tommy turns and walks on down the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunny day. And a nearly abandoned school parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nash, Tito, and KC wait outside the Principal's office. I quiet and aside from one SECRETARY, there's no one around After a moment, Stephon comes walking in, and they all st up and head into the Principal's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids walk in. Zito looks up and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You realize you're supposed to seek my wise counsel when school's actually in session, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All four of them laugh nervously. Working their way up to something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want to use the auditorium this weekend to watch Mr. C in Sparta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me get this straight. You want to use the auditorium to watch a suspended teacher engage in the activity he was suspended for? Am I hearing this correctly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta talk to your parents. You guys might need to be in summer school after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But everyone wants to see it. 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gym's the only place that's big enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's never gonna happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if we get a petition?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. We'll get the whole school to sign it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The power of democracy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I appreciate that you guys love your teacher. I really do. But there is nothing I can do for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zito turns and heads back to his desk. The kids, dejected leave the office and walk off down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Goodyear BLIMP, "SPARTA IS HERE" blinking on it, floa over Atlantic City. FIREWORKS explode majestically above Boardwalk Hall and fall into the sea, where hundreds of b bob, televisions tuned to Sparta visible from many of the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOUSANDS OF PEOPLE cram the beach and boardwalk, crane t necks toward the sky, and watch the stunning pyrotechnics the streets, limos line up on Ocean Avenue. Even from a distance, the excitement and energy are palpable.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The roof is about to blow clean off Boardwalk Hall Arena! It might be Fourth of July weekend, but this is Christmas Eve for fight fans! This is Atlantic City! This is the War on the Shore! And this is what everyone has been waiting for!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enormous electronic BILLBOARDS flash outside of the giant seaside casinos. On one, Koba hangs off the side of a fer wheel and swats at smaller fighters buzzing around him in replication of the iconic "King Kong" movie scene. 61.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Sixteen of the baddest men on the planet duking it out over a 24-hour period for the largest purse in Mixed Martial Arts history. In the town everyone knows from the game of Monopoly, we've got ourselves a winner-take-all affair. Buckle your seatbelts, roll the dice, and take riiiiide on the Reading. Sparta. Is. Here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Play by play announcer Sam Sheridan and color analyst Bry Callen stand cageside. The arena is packed to capacity an buzzing with anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome, I'm Bryan Callen along with best-selling fight author Sam Sheridan. Sam, when J.J. Riley conceived Sparta he wanted to create, quite simply, the biggest Mixed Martial Arts spectacle in history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five million dollars, Bryan. Five million dollars. J.J. Riley put his money where his mouth is and put up the biggest purse this sport has ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's unprecedented, Sam. As is the hoopla surrounding Tommy Riordan, the war hero who has become an overnight sensation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy lays on the ground near the showers, collecting his thoughts. As Paddy watches a TV monitor showing Callen an Sheridan, an OFFICIAL pokes his head into the locker room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five minutes, Paddy. 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenroy and a group of FIGHTERS gather around a TV in the A very fired up group.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It looks as though the moment of truth has arrived, because here comes Tommy Riordan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Tommy makes his way toward the cage and the strobe lig sweep over nearly 15,000 SCREAMING FANS, not one of them sitting.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Tommy Riordan's captured the media's attention, but the question still remains: who is this guy? And more importantly, can he compete in this talent pool? Can he win?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I wish I knew, Bryan. I wish I knew who he was, and I've gotta say the fact that I don't know is strange. In an internet age where there are no secrets, this guy is a complete mystery. I can't find out anything about him. Tommy Riordan is officially Google proof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy continues to storm toward the cage with a furious a focused look on his face. He seems to want nothing to do Paddy. Training is over. It's time to fight.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You gotta love this guy, Sam. No walk out music, no sponsors, no interviews. He skipped out on the press conference. Wouldn't have his picture take for the program. He's breaking every rule! 63.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The only reason that Tommy is even in this tournament is because of a video showing him beating up Mad Dog Grimes in the gym.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But the reason a lot of his fans are in the stands is because of another video, which is even more stunning than the Mad Dog Grimes video. Let me describe it for you folks for the few who haven't seen it, and I don't know anyone who hasn't, but Tommy Riordan ripped the door off a tank in the heat of battle, saving lives in the process, and then walked away without claiming a medal. He ripped the door off a tank!

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Tommy Riordan is a genuine war hero, I'm not taking anything away from the guy. He's a very, very tough guy, Bryan, but the tank don't hit back. We've seen YouTube sensations fail on the big stage before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy stands outside the cage and has Vaseline applied to face. He looks like he's ready to murder someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam. He ripped the door off a tank!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank holds mitts for Brendan as a TV plays.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Tommy Riordan definitely has his hands full in his first opponent, Francisco Barbosa. Barbosa is nothing to scoff at.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yeah, he's the real deal. Very tough guy. Very high caliber fighter. Tommy Riordan came out of nowhere, and I imagine he's going to disappear just as quickly.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Great story, but I think your boy is about to be exposed as a YouTube sensation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON TV SCREEN: REFEREE JOSH ROSENTHAL (30s) GIVES INSTRUCT TO TOMMY AND HIS OPPONENT, FRANCISCO BARBOSA (20s). THE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy and Barbosa face to face as JOSH ROSENTHAL instruct

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, you've been given your instructions. I expect a clean fight. Obey my commands at all times. Defend yourselves at all times. Touch gloves, go back, let's do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the crowd, two sections of MARINES in full dress unifo wave flags and raise about as much hell as humanly possib for Tommy, who returns to his corner. Paddy attempts to g him some advice, but Tommy is not listening.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We're about to get the big answer to the big question: is Tommy Riordan for real? And here we go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bell rings. DING! And Tommy comes out fast and hard.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Barbosa's gonna be looking for a take down.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Definitely gonna be looking for a take down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There will not be a take down. Tommy ducks a blow, then levels Barbosa with a massive and brutal LEFT HOOK. The Brazilian's head snaps sideways, his MOUTHPIECE goes flyi and he does a face plant on to the canvas. It's over.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Barbosa is down! Barbosa has been knocked out! Tommy Riordan is most definitely for real!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the crowd erupts and Josh Rosenthal waves to Barbosa's corner to get a medic in there, Tommy marches out of the without waiting for an official announcement. 65.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And now he's walking out of the cage! He's leaving the cage! There goes another rule out the window!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenroy and the boys fired up. They can't believe the ferocious knockout they've just witnessed.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Francisco Barbosa is out cold, and he is out of this tournament, Bryan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The official pokes his head into the locker room where Fr and a nervous Brendan sit alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the TV monitor, Tommy's annihilating knockout of Franc Barbosa plays. Then, in the distance, the strains of CLASSICAL MUSIC can be heard. Brendan looks at Frank, who smiles and puts his hands on Brendan's shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs the nervous Brendan's head between his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to hear you say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's go do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUZZING in the crowd. Another fight close at hand.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: J.J. Riley had less than 48 hours to fill Marco Santos' spot, and he basically had to rely on the word of Frank Campana. 66.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And he chose Brendan Conlon, which quite frankly is something I just don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan and Frank walk down the tunnel toward the arena, where Paddy is waiting, his All Access pass around his ne Brendan notices the old man as he approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go get `em, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan barely acknowledges Paddy and keeps walking. Fran looks at Brendan with a "Who the hell is that?" expressio As they approach the dark lights of the arena, Beethoven continues to BOOM out over the loud speakers.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I can understand coming out to no music, by why in the world would you choose classical music for your entrance?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is Beethoven, Bryan. This is Ode to Joy.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: My apologies, Mr. Renaissance man.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You want to talk about renaissance men, you gotta talk about Frank Campana. Very unorthodox trainer, and one of the best in the game. He's well known for using classical music to train his fighters to remain calm, to remain patient, and to remain composed under pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan and Frank make their way through the crowd and to cageside, where Bryan Callen reaches beneath his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Classical music is about as fitting to this setting as Brendan Conlon is to this tournament. In fact, let me show you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Callen holds up a plastic bag with water and a GOLDFISH inside. 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Brendan Conlon. He's a feeder fish, and he's about to get dropped into a shark tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan gets greased up, then climbs into the cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, give the guy a break. At least we've seen him fight before. He was in the UFC. We remember him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember him, too. I remember him being very unmemorable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nervous Tess sits at the table, failing to concentrate folding laundry. The TV in front of her is off, but she glances at it anyway. In front of her sits a CELL PHONE. glances at it repeatedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan stands in the corner as his opponent, ORLANDO "MIDNIGHT" LE climbs in, shoulders bulging and abs shredd

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Midnight Le getting ready to climb into the cage and go to work.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: When the brackets were announced, Midnight thought he'd be going up against Marco Santos. He's gotta be thrilled to be seeing Brendan Conlon standing across from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan stands in the corner and looks at the massive Midnight Le. Frank smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asked for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan grins and looks out at the rabid crowd. 68.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Brendan retired from fighting some years ago, he's actually a high school Physics teacher now, and Midnight had some fun with that at the press conference.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He said he was gonna give the teacher a serious lesson, and that getting killed was no way to spend a summer vacation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh Rosenthal waves the two fighters into the center of cage for instructions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, gentleman, you've been given your instructions, I expect a clean fight. Obey my commands at all times. Defend yourselves at all times. Touch gloves, go back, let's do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fighters head to their corners and wait for the bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have some fun, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the sound of the bell, "Midnight" Le comes out hard an strong. He repeatedly KICKS Brendan in the leg and batter him with STRIKES. His power is overwhelming Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy stares at the TV monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy lays on the rubdown table, his eyes closed. No inte in Brendan's fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe Zito sits on a couch in his suburban home and watches Brendan on TV. He's a nervous wreck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move! You gotta move! 69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank exhorts Brendan from cageside, telling him to relax but it's no use. It's an unholy beating going in the cage

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zito drinks a glass of Scotch.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Midnight is all over Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This can't last much longer. This won't last much longer. The teacher just has no answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zito leans forward. He looks as if he's going to have a h attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Brendan, get outta there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Midnight Le takes Brendan to the ground. Brendan tries to escape, but turns his back, allowing Midnight to sink in rear naked CHOKE. He puts the strangle hold on Brendan an squeezes his neck with his enormous biceps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of there! Get out of there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan tries to pry Midnight's hands off him. No use.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And now he's got the hooks in. 20 seconds left.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The end is near. Can he make it to the end of the round is the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Midnight squeezes for all it's worth as Frank screams at Brendan, imploring him not to tap. 70.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: 10 seconds left, and Brendan's face is turning purple. Conlon's whole world is about to go from day to night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan is on the verge of going unconscious, but he refu to tap out. Then the HORN blows ending the round. The cro can't believe Brendan hung in there, and neither can Midn Le, who slams the canvas in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Midnight walks back toward his angry TRAINER, who expe him to finish Brendan early, the teacher heads toward a smiling Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful! Beautiful! He doesn't know what hit him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan grins at Frank's positive spin on things, then lo across the cage at Midnight Le, who glares at Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The frazzled Zito continues to root for Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An excited Paddy watches Brendan on the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Midnight continues pounding on Brendan, but Brendan start giving back, working a few leg kicks of his own. He seems be gaining confidence. From cageside, Frank HOLLERS words encouragement as the battle continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back and forth they go. Midnight rocks Brendan with a rig hand. Brendan recovers and fires back. Then Midnight shoo in for a take down, but Brendan dodges him, reverses position, and suddenly takes a shocked Midnight down to t ground. The crowd is on its collective feet.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He's got a Kimura locked in.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me? 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan locks up Midnight's shoulder. Applies pressure. T bigger fighter struggles to get free, but he seems to be trapped. From cageside, Frank screams, instructing Brenda how to finish the move.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Midnight is in big trouble!

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I don't think he's got anywhere to go!

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This isn't happening! This can't happen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Midnight TAPS and the crowd EXPLODES. Shock and mayhem throughout the arena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just did, Bryan.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Brendan Conlon tapped Midnight! I can't believe it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Principal Zito leaps off his couch, SCREAMING in celebrat ZITO'S WIFE (40s), drying dishes, pokes her head in the r as the Principal pumps his fist over and over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tapped him out! He tapped him out! He did it! He did it! He did it!

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is what makes Mixed Martial Arts so great. There's so many ways to lose. One tiny miscalculation at any time and that's it.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Frank Campana embracing his man, Brendan Conlon. I don't think either one of them can believe what just happened. 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Brendan embrace. The arena is BUZZING. Midnight gets off the canvas, and Brendan approaches him and bows. dejected Midnight bows in return.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Great show of sportsmanship from the teacher.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That's a hallmark of Frank Campana's philosophy right there.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Midnight Le is shocked. He thought he had a free pass into the second round, but instead he's going home. He dominated the fight the entire way, but fell prey to a very technical finish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very technical finish, but come on, that's a fluke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A jubilant Brendan raises his arms in victory. The crowd responds to the gutsy underdog.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You call it a fluke. I call it a guy maintaining composure and waiting for his opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Conlon beats Midnight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the celebration continues, Callen looks at Sheridan an shakes his head. Was he ever wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you got a receipt for your goldfish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess sits on the couch, TV still off. Her phone BEEPS. Sh grabs it quickly. A text reads: "I WON!!!!!!!!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts dancing around the room, kissing her phone. 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy and Paddy sit and watch the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We're down to eight fighters, soon to be seven as Koba prepares to go to work for the second time tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the sound of the BELL, Koba sprints across the ring an delivers a flying kick to the chest of his already retrea OPPONENT. He picks him up with incredible strength, then SLAMS him into the ground and pounds his brains in. The w thing is over in under 10 seconds.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That was quick.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Wow. Once again, Koba does not break a sweat.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'm afraid he might have broken something else, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It's certainly possible, Bryan. Koba moving on to tomorrow night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan and Frank stare at a monitor. They look worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON TV SCREEN: KOBA's OPPONENT GETTING ATTENDED TO AFTER T BEATING BY THE MIGHTY RUSSIAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy and Paddy sit on stools opposite each other, Paddy taping him up. Tommy keeps a lazy eye on a monitor, where Dog Grimes is fighting.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Mad Dog fighting like a man possessed. Like a man with something to prove.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Mad Dog said he had a message for Tommy Riordan and there it is right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan and Frank stand in the tunnel as the house lights down in the arena.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Here comes the underdog, Brendan Conlon.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The teacher miraculously passed his first test, but now he's gotta face The Dane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy stands amidst the crowd in the tunnel and gives Bre a thumbs-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do it, Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan glares at him and marches toward the cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess, now watching the fights on TV, stands in front of t screen and bites her nails. She looks like she's about to throw up.

dialogues.speaker: ON TV SCREEN
dialogues.text: KRULLER (30s), WHO POUNDS ON HIM WITHOUT MERCY.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Halfway through round three now and the beating continues.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I honestly don't know how Brendan Conlon is still standing, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He has been absolutely battered in both his fights tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KARL "THE DANE" KRULLER presses Brendan against the fence knees him repeatedly in the midsection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess can barely watch the beating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank shouts instructions as Brendan and The Dane tangle against the fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take him down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan grabs Kruller and FLIPS him to the canvas. Then h spins for an ARM BAR, a move similar to one seen earlier the smoker fights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zito, now joined by his wife. Both on the edge of the cou and sucked into the action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan twists Kruller's arm. He's got him in a terrible position, much like Midnight. The Dane SQUIRMs. Looks for escape. It's not there. With Brendan applying tremendous pressure to his arm, he TAPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy watches from the tunnel as the crowd goes insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it, Brendan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess does a wild JIG in front of the TV. 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zito and his wife, arm in arm in celebration.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Do it one time, it's a fluke, do it twice, that's something else!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and a victorious Brendan embrace.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Pull the bandwagon over, I think I'm hopping on! I think I'm a believer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy's waiting in the tunnel for Brendan, who comes thro full of adrenaline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way to go, Brendan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd doing this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm doing it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenroy and the gang around the big screen again.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The crowd catching fire for war hero Tommy Riordan. 77.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He doesn't seem to want anything to do with all this adulation, Bryan. He's just here to fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy climbs into the cage. A Mexican fighter, DIEGO SANT (20s), is waiting for him. Josh Rosenthal points at both

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, you ready? You ready? Let's go to war!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bell RINGS and Tommy goes right after Santana and sta administering a beating. He bullies him into the cage and starts raining BLOWS all over him.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Here he comes again like a buzzsaw. Tommy is all over Diego Santana!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd raising cain for Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh Rosenthal pulls Tommy off the brutalized Diego Santa before he kills him. Once again, Tommy marches straight o of the cage.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There he goes again! Storming right out of the cage!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy marches past Paddy again, then off through the crow

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Tommy Riordan marching through the crowd, and straight into the final four!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The arena is on its collective feet CHANTING "Tommy! Tomm Tommy!" As Paddy looks on and Tommy disappears into the darkness of the tunnel, the sound of cheering fades. 78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dawn breaks over Atlantic City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CLEANING WOMAN vacuums as an elevator door DINGS and op Out comes Paddy. The casino is nearly empty, the only sou coming from the tinny RINGING of a handful of slot machin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a distance, Paddy spots Tommy sitting at the far end a bank of Triple 7 American Glory slot machines, mechanic feeding the slot from a tray full of silver and pulling t lever with a thousand-yard stare. Paddy approaches Tommy, doesn't acknowledge him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't sleep, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy feeds the machine and pulls. Says nothing. Paddy si down in front of a slot machine next to Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that other thing's bothering the hell out of you, but I'm proud of you. What you did for that kid in the tank? That was really something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about deserting my unit? Is that really something, too? Yeah. I was on my way outta country when I came across those guys. What was I supposed to do, let `em drown?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd I do? I took off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy starts putting things together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why you go by Riordan. That's why the press can't find your service records.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy doesn't respond. 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell happened over there, Tommy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is none of your business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, kiddo. I've been there. I've done it. I've seen it. You can trust me. I'll understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spare me the compassionate father routine, Pop. The suit don't fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really trying here, Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're trying? Now? Where were you when it mattered? I needed this guy back when I was a kid. I don't need you now. It's too late now. Everything's already happened. You and Brendan don't seem to understand that. Let me explain something to you: the only thing I have in common with Brendan Conlon is that we have absolutely no use for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy's shaken. He can't fathom the anger in Tommy, yet h knows he's responsible. It's written all over him. Tears up in his eyes. They seem to make Tommy madder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at you. Yeah, I was right. I think I liked you better when you were a drunk. At least you had some balls then. Not like now. Tip toeing around like some beggar with your cup out. Take it somewhere else, old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy reaches down and picks up a plastic CUP made for holding coins and dips it into his tray, filling it with QUARTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact, you know what? Here's a cup. Why don't you take this and go buy some more of your shitty tapes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back to the room and listen to some more fish stories no one gives a shit about. Go on, get outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck outta here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy whips the bucket toward his father, splashing COINS into his face. A stunned Paddy, tears streaming down his face, walks off. A handful of late-night GAMBLERS look at Tommy, who stares angrily ahead and bounces a quarter off slot machine as his destroyed father limps away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourth of July weekend in full swing down the Shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy staggers about in pajama bottoms and a stained V-ne clutching his Walkman and a bottle of WHISKEY. "Moby Dick plays from ear phones that are half on his head and half LIQUOR BOTTLES are strewn everywhere. He has obviously fa off the wagon. Hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God pity `em! All shall perish except me! You bastards! Stop the ship, you bastards!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He staggers around the room, giving a fragmented soliloqu no audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ishmael! God pity `em! Stop the ship! Please stop the ship! Somebody help `em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the adjoining door swings open. Tommy, hair disheveled, looks in and sees Paddy's state. The old man thrusts his hand up in the air and screams at Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahab! You Godless sonofabitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy staggers over and gets in Tommy's face, his own fac blotched and contorted. The old Paddy Conlon revealed. Th monster from the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stop the ship, you Godless sonofabitch! 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no anger in Tommy. He simply walks toward the old and tries to pry the bottle out of his hand. As he strugg to take it, the Walkman falls to the ground. Faint dialog is heard coming from the earphones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain. Oh captain. Stop the ship. For the love of God. We're lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old man is running out of steam. He begins WEEPING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please stop the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy wobbles, tears streaming down his face. Tommy looks him. The first time we've seen anything resembling compas on that relentless face of his. He HUGS his father and pr the whiskey bottle from his hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're lost. We're all lost, Tommy. We'll never make it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy pulls his father back on to the bed. Puts his arms around his chest and tries to quiet the old man. It's a tender moment, and it seems as if Tommy is only able to relate to the brutal, former version of the father he kne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always loved you. You know that, don't you Tommy? I always loved you. You and your brother. My two boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy continues to hold his father as sunlight streams in the room. The end of a very long night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bigger, even more bombastic FIREWORKS display than befo explodes over Atlantic City. If it's possible, the CROWDS the beach and boardwalk have swelled. It seems as if the entire east coast has descended on AC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside Boardwalk Hall, the giant electronic BILLBOARD ha new motif. Koba still swings mightily from the side of a ferris wheel, but now Tommy, in a camouflage superhero outfit, flies right toward him. On a collision course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mad Dog Grimes holds on to Tommy's cape, trying to slow h down, and below the three of them, in miniature, is Brend holding a sling shot. 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd at a fever pitch. Two sections full of MARINES dress uniforms cheer insanely. So does an entire section GIRLS wearing camouflage tank tops and holding up signs reading "TOMMY GIRLS." Everyone in the arena chants "Tomm Tommy! Tommy!" A cult hero has been born.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Tommy Riordan, coming down the tunnel without his trainer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colt's is packed. FIGHTERS. PEOPLE off the street. VETS i fatigues. A bigger crowd than before.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Once again, no walk out music.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I wouldn't say no walk out music, Sam. Listen to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Marines are on their feet, singing "HALLS OF MONTEZUM at the top of their lungs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the halls of Montezuma to the shores of Tripoli, we will fight our country's battles in the air, on land, and sea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At cageside, Sheridan leans over to Callen, raising his v to be heard above the Marines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds like VJ Day in Times Square, Bryan. I've never seen anything like it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy climbs up the stairs and into the cage. He turns an nods at the Marines. 83.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Tommy acknowledging his comrades for the first time, and climbing into the cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd at the gym both CHEERS and JEERS at the TV.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Mad Dog Grimes has been looking for revenge ever since the day Tommy Riordan walked into his gym in Pittsburgh and turned his life upside down.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It's been a very long, very miserable few months for Mad Dog to say the least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mad Dog and Tommy in a STARE DOWN as Josh Rosenthal attem to give them instructions. Unless Mad Dog's mother is in building, every single person in the Boardwalk Hall is rooting for Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Mad Dog mocking Tommy with a camouflage motif for his mohawk tonight and the Marines are really letting Mad Dog have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Marines hoot and holler at Mad Dog as Josh Rosenthal over his instructions with the two fighters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright gentlemen, you've been given your instructions. I expect a clean fight. Obey my commands at all times. Defend yourselves at all times. Touch gloves, go back, let's do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the center of the cage, Mad Dog is practically spittin Tommy's face. Tommy's eyelids droop. He could not be less intimidated. 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not gonna happen again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Callen and Sheridan look on as the two fighters retreat t their corners. The anticipation in the arena is incredibl

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Mad Dog predicted an early knockout. Said he was gonna knock Tommy out with one punch.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Let's see what Tommy has to say about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh Rosenthal looks at Tommy and Mad Dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, you ready? You ready? Let's go to war!

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And they are off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy goes after Mad Dog like it's the last night on eart What Tommy did to him at Colt's Gym was an exercise in restraint compared to what's happening in that cage.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Tommy tackles him and he's on top! He's raining blows!

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Someone has to stop this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mad Dog is on his back and being pounded on. Tommy's rage shocking, even by his own brutal standards. From cageside Colt Boyd SCREAMS at Josh Rosenthal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it! Stop the fight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's such a savage beating, so malicious, that Rosenthal to climb on Tommy's back to get him off of Mad Dog. If hi mother is indeed in the crowd, she couldn't recognize him now. Beaten to an absolute pulp.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That's the fastest knockout I think I've ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Mad Dog Grimes has been poleaxed. He is not moving. 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy marches out of the cage and past Colt Boyd, Punkass and SkySkrape, who can't believe what they just witnessed Neither can anyone else at Boardwalk Hall. In the cage, a MEDIC tends to Mad Dog.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what: you do that to someone on the street and they'd lock you up and throw away the key! Break out the yellow tape, Sam. Tommy's walking away from the cage like he's leaving a crime scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "ODE TO JOY" is heard coming from distant speakers as ROW CARS line up at the entrance and pull into the lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull back to reveal an enormous, old drive-in movie theat packed with a RAUCOUS CROWD. On the gigantic MOVIE SCREEN Brendan makes his way through the arena and into the cage he does, CHEERS erupt in the parking lot. Stephon, Nash, Tito, and some of the other students from Brendan's class root him on. They came up with a pretty good Plan B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the kids get fired up for the fight, they're joined by familiar face that emerges from the crowd. Joe Zito. Tito shakes his hand. Smacks Stephon. Look who's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan climbs into the cage to a major OVATION from the crowd. They're completely on his side now.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Brendan Conlon came into this tournament as a 1000 to 1 underdog, and now here he is in the final four. The crowd's showing their appreciation. They're giving him quite the reception.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He's getting a huge reception. I mean, this guy shocked everybody last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan stands in the corner. Frank leans over the railin the cage and smiles at him. 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a visitor. Second row, 10 o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buzzing in the arena. The lights about to go down for the entrance of Koba. Before they do, Brendan looks up to see familiar face at cageside. Tess. He can't believe his eye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You alright with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan looks at his wife. She smiles broadly. Mouths the words "I love you." Brendan grins. Kisses his glove and presses it against the cage. As he does, the lights go ou inside the arena and ominous RUSSIAN MUSIC BLARES.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And here comes the great Russian Koba.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Koba is so intimidating. His reputation is larger than life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd strains to get a look at the legend as he makes way toward the cage. Brendan watches. So does Frank. Tess takes a quick glance at Koba, then looks away. She can't it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to look right at him when he comes in here. Don't take your eyes off him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan nods, then looks at Tess. Drawing strength. Frank leans over the railing and taps fists with his fighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm proud of you brother. This is your cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, the creepy music subsides, and the great Russian climbs into the cage. He's massive, and the crowd stares him like an exotic animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh Rosenthal calls Brendan and Koba to the center of th cage. The Russian looks at Brendan with the cold, dispassionate eyes of a killer. Brendan does his best to his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, gentlemen, you've been given your instructions. I expect a clean fight.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH ROSENTHAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Obey my commands at all times. Defend yourselves at all times. Touch gloves, go back, let's do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan retreats to his corner. Takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Should I be nervous for Brendan? `Cause I am. I want to stop the fight before it even begins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, you ready? You ready? Let's go to war!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Koba comes straight at Brendan. His speed and strength ar astonishing.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Now the question is, how long can Brendan Conlon stay alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Franks screams at Brendan to keep his distance. Tess watc through her fingers. And Koba keeps coming, snapping Brendan's head back with a jab and bludgeoning him with a uppercut to the chin. The Russian is doing whatever he wa to Brendan. He slices him up with strikes. Bruises his le with kicks. Works him against the fence. Power slams him.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Koba just pounding on Brendan Conlon! He's pounding on him like a side of beef!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thousands of people staring at the drive-in screen and yo can hear a pin drop. They're aghast. Zito can hardly look buries her head in Nash's chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Koba gets Brendan in a BEAR HUG, lifts him off the ground carries him into the center of the ring like a sack of laundry, and body SLAMS him on his back.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Koba's got him in the air. Oh no! 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Frank screams for Brendan to remain calm, a mortified watches. Mercifully, the HORN sounds, and Brendan survive the round. He barely makes it back to his corner.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Frank Campana has to think seriously about stopping this.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Seriously, Sam. How much abuse can one man take?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The minutes passes in no time. It's time to go again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go to war!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Koba comes right after Brendan, and it's soon more of the same. Power slams. Brutal strikes. Brendan's face is carv up and battered. He tries to go for a take down, but Koba snuffs it, then lifts Brendan off the mat again and carri him through the air. Frank screams, but there's nothing h can do. Brendan is brutally SLAMMED into the ground.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Uh oh, Brendan's going for ride!

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That one shook the entire building!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Brendan writhes on the ground, Koba grabs him and slin him against the fence like it's nothing. Brendan flies through the air and RATTLES against the cage. Then Koba climbs on top of him and starts whaling away. Tess can't watch it. Once again, just as Rosenthal is about to stop fight, the HORN sounds.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Everyone has gotta be concerned about Brendan Conlon's bravery getting him into trouble here.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: His bravery can get him killed, Sam. He's got nothing more to prove. He's already lasted two rounds against Koba, which is more than anyone else can say. You wonder what's keeping this guy up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan drags himself off the ground and limps to his sto Frank enters the cage. His usual positive attitude is gon He comes at Brendan with aggression instead. 89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down. Breathe. (grabbing Brendan's face) Look at me! Look at me! Why are we here, Brendan? Why are we here? Are we here to win this fight? You tell me, `cause if we're not, I'll throw in the towel right now. We'll get Tess and we will go home. You don't knock him out, you lose the fight. Understand me? You don't knock him out, you don't have a home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh Rosenthal claps his hands. Frank takes his cue to le but not before giving Brendan one last look. It's now or never. Brendan looks across the cage at Koba. Steels hims

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go to war!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan comes out and meets Koba in the center of the cag but the Russian resumes his supremacy.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Conlon somehow answering the bell for round three, but Koba's all over him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Koba roughs the battered Brendan up some more, but then Brendan starts responding. Throws a couple effective leg kicks. A decent punch or two.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Brendan's giving back, Bryan. There are signs of life in Brendan Conlon. He's starting to mix it up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parking lot is quiet and tense. Zito and the kids sta at the movie screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Russian SQUEEZES away. 90.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Koba's got him caught in an iron vice, squeezing for all it's worth and trying to choke the teacher out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank screams at Brendan to stay calm. To wait for his moment. Koba continues to squeeze. Brendan's face turns m and more red. Finally, he grabs Koba's shorts, musters up the strength he has left, and TOSSES the Russian on his b freeing himself from the choke in the process.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He just launched Koba! Can you believe this? Conlon just shook off a guillotine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan jumps on Koba and attempts his own choke.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Conlon's staying after him! He's squeezing him! The tables have turned, and the boy scout is squeezing the bear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Koba shakes off Brendan's submission attempt and stands. Brendan stands with him and they exchange a vicious round blows. Brendan's giving as good as he's getting.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Conlon standing and trading with the Russian! I've never seen this!

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is a fight! We've got ourselves a fight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan snaps Koba's head back with a left, but the Russi responds with a combination. Brendan stumbles backwards, Koba grabs him and tries to take him down. Brendan throws left ELBOW that connects with Koba's temple. The Russian momentarily STUNNED, long enough for Brendan to take him the ground and wrap his arms around Koba's KNEE.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Conlon going for a knee bar! He's got it very deep!

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He's deep on that knee bar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan wrenches his body for all it's worth. Frank pound the apron of the cage. 91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crank it! Crank it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Russian tries to squirm away, but he can't. His face contorted in PAIN. The cageside OFFICIAL indicates there' only 10 seconds left in the fight.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Brendan Conlon wrenching that knee for all it's worth! He's putting everything he has in it, and Koba is screaming in pain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four. Three. Koba struggles. Grimaces in agony. Brendan k wrenching his knee. Two. He can't take it. One. He TAPS!

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He did it! Brendan Conlon has tapped Koba! I can't believe it! He can't believe it! Frank Campana can't believe it! This whole place can't believe it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drive-in crowd goes absolutely BERSERK. Tito leaps in Nash's arms. Stephon hugs KC. Zito pumps his fist in the

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That's gotta be the biggest upset in MMA history! Brendan Conlon has tapped the great Koba!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess stands on her seat, shrieking. Brendan climbs on top the railing and lifts his arms in the air, a look off sho on his face. The arena goes bananas.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Brendan Conlon, the Physics teacher! Brendan Conlon, the civilian! He's done the impossible! He's pulled off a miracle! This place is going crazy `cause we've just seen a miracle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pure bedlam in Boardwalk Hall. Frank going wild. Tess. Th TapouT crew. J.J. Riley. Just an extraordinary scene. Finally, the noise fades away. 92.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is CNN breaking news...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.J. Riley, the TapouT crew, and a few OFFICIALS stand ov computer screen on press row. They wear headphones and shocked expressions.

dialogues.speaker: DON LEMON, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: A surprising turn in the story of Iraq War hero Tommy Riordan. CNN has learned that Riordan's true identity is that of Marine Staff Sergeant Thomas Conlon, who went AWOL from his unit earlier this year following the friendly fire death of his brother-in-arms, Sergeant Manny Fernandez. Fernandez' wife, Pilar Fernandez, spoke with me in an exclusive interview moments ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley and the others look at one another. They can't beli what they're hearing.

dialogues.speaker: PILAR, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Bombs started dropping. They were coming from U.S. planes. Tommy and Manny were waving their flags to let them know they were Americans, but they didn't stop. Everyone died. Everyone except Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, my Manny used to say Tommy was the brother he never had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two MARINE MPS stand guard outside Tommy's locker room. 93.

dialogues.speaker: DON LEMON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Conlon, who is fighting in the Mixed Martial Arts mega tournament Sparta, is expected to be taken into custody by military police following tonight's winner take all finale in Atlantic City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy sits in his locker room. Another MP stands behind h

dialogues.speaker: DON LEMON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: If victorious, he has pledged his five million dollar purse to the widow of his fallen comrade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.J. Riley sidles up between Callen and Sheridan and WHIS in their ears. They're stunned by the news as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tito and the kids sit on the hoods of cars eating hot dog and waiting for the final fight. Joe Zito looks up at the movie screen, where Bryan Callen makes an announcement.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: We've just got some incredible news that I'm having trouble putting into context, but here it is: the two men fighting for the championship tonight, for the five million dollar prize, for the middle weight championship of the world, are brothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stunned expressions from Zito, KC, Nash, Stephon, Tito, a everyone at the Drive-In. The wild night has taken an unexpected turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan, Frank, and Tess sit in the locker room. On the monitor, Callen and Sheridan continue to discuss the situation. Brendan has ice packs on his shoulders and kne and his face is a mess after three brutal wars in 24 hour 94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna fight him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy sits by himself in his locker room, the weight of t world pulling his shoulders down. His black hoodie is ove his head. He couldn't be more alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sobered up Paddy runs out of the hotel and climbs into waiting taxi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan and Frank make the long walk down the tunnel and the arena. Unlike previous trips, there is no joy on thei faces. It's a grim march to the cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People stand on cars. Chairs. Each other's shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tito, KC, Nash, Stephon, and the other students start chanting "Mis-ter C! Mis-ter C! Mis-ter C!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy rises and walks toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He marches out the door and into the bowels of the arena, moving past MPS as he goes. His march is as grim as Brendan's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan and Frank embrace. 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan climbs into the cage as the house LIGHTS DIM. The crowd is going bonkers. And they EXPLODE when Tommy appea at the end of the tunnel with his hoodie up and begins hi march toward the cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Marines shower him with cheers and "Hoo-ahs." The gir scream. The rest of the audience stamps their feet and ch his name. But he acknowledges no one, and the hard look o his face never wavers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenroy and the crew on the edge of their seats, all stari at the big screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nervous Paddy sits in the back of the cab as the DRIVER navigates through holiday traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here it is. The two brothers face to face in the midd of the ring, staring each other down. Tommy with his usua controlled fire, Brendan intense, searching his brother's eyes for some flicker of recognition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, this is the final. Five rounds. I expect a clean fight. Obey my commands at all times. Defend yourselves at all times. Touch gloves, go back, let's do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Rosenthal finishes his instructions, Brendan peers int Tommy's empty corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Pop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy turns without answering. All business. Brendan retu to his corner. Looks at Tess. So much emotion on her face 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, are you ready? Are you ready? Let's go to war!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy comes right after his brother. Just like with his previous three opponents. A natural wrecking machine. Fra screams at Brendan to stay calm, but Tommy is all over hi POUNDING on him with savage intensity. As bad as the othe fights were for Brendan, this one is worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd is tense and subdued. It's not going well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenroy and company thoroughly enjoying themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy continues to batter Brendan, then he swoops in, pic him up, and SLAMS his big brother into the ground. Then h does it again. And again. And again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan, the wind knocked out of him, is on his back, try to protect himself from Tommy, who mounts him and starts blasting away with a BLUR of lefts and rights. The only t that saves Brendan is the HORN. Which Tommy ignores, blas his brother with a brutal CHEAP SHOT to the jaw well afte the round had ended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Josh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan lays on the ground as Josh Rosenthal pulls Tommy him and admonishes him for the cheap shot. Tommy stares a Brendan. You want more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank runs into the cage with the stool and Brendan limps over to him and sits down. Brendan stares at Tommy, who p in his corner like a caged animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down. Look at me. Look at me, Brendan! Let it go! Breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beethoven. He's coming hard, just like we planned. I want you to angle out, hit, and move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angle out, hit, and move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Breathe. Relax. He's not your brother, right? He's just a guy who's in the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh Rosenthal claps his hands. It's time. Frank glares a him as he picks up the stool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking a little more time for the cheap shot! Do your job, Josh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess sits uncomfortably in her chair. Her husband's face mess. In front of her, Callen and Sheridan commiserate. J the TapouT crew, and Colt Boyd look on. The electricity i the crowd is greater than ever. They want a champion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very quiet at the Drive-In. It's tough for everyone to wa what's happening to Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Marines in the crowd are all on their feet, screaming Tommy to end it. The chant starts up again. 15,000 strong "Tommy! Tommy! Tommy!" Frank tries to instruct Brendan, b he can't hear him, and he's too overwhelmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy presses Brendan against the cage and does the same thing Koba did. He lifts him off the ground, carries him dead run, and body SLAMS him so hard the cage shakes. The Tommy mounts him and starts pounding away again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HORN sounds ending the round, but this time it's Bren who pops up and pushes Tommy. Tommy shoves him back. Rosenthal has to separate them as the crowd roars its approval. 98.

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Here we go, Mom! Time to lock up your china, the boys are at it again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenroy and company watching the big screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, Tommy is on top of Brendan, trying to ground and p him into submission. Frank, leaning on the apron nearby, screams at Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Switch! Switch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy tries to pound Brendan out, but Brendan latches on Tommy's arm, wraps his legs around him, and REVERSES position, just as he did with Midnight, the Dane, and Kob Tommy is in deep trouble. Brendan pushes him face down on canvas and cranks his shoulder. There's no escape.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Oh my God, that's a deep omoplata!

dialogues.speaker: CALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He's doing it again! Conlon's doing it again! This is going to be over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan applies intense pressure. Tommy's shoulder is contorted, WRENCHED backwards, and his face is a mask of pain. Tommy's in agony, but he won't give in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tap, Tommy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy SHRIEKS like an animal, but still won't quit. In fa he elbows Brendan in the face in defiance. Brendan in tur cranks the shoulder even more. It's at the breaking point

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tap!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shoulder twists. Twists. And then, audible only to To and Brendan, CRACK. Dislocated. Then the HORN ending the round. 99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan, worried he hurt his brother, leans over to see i Tommy's alright, but Tommy, like a wounded animal, leaps and grabs Brendan around the throat with his one good arm shoves him all the way across the cage and into the fence and it takes Rosenthal and Frank to separate them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd fired up by Brendan's comeback, and mesmerized what's taking place in the cage between the brothers. It' complete and utter chaos in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheer amazement that Tommy didn't submit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy, flap down, tears of pain pouring down his face, st defiantly in his corner. In the other corner, Frank atten Brendan. In the crowd, Tess covers her mouth. She can't believe what Tommy allowed to happen to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank puts the stool down and gives Brendan some water. Brendan's face is wracked with guilt and concern over his brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I popped his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard it tear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You popped his shoulder? Good. I want you to pop his other shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not what Brendan wants to hear. He looks over to Rosenthal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh! 100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank snaps. Grabs Brendan by the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Hey! No Josh! Look at me! You got two rounds left! You need both rounds! Go in there, kick him in the head, take him down, and finish him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosenthal claps his hands. Frank exits the cage. The woun Tommy stands in his corner, his ruined left arm hanging l Brendan makes eye contact with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy! What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you that crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go to war!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BELL sounds. Round Four begins. Tommy throws useless right jabs. He's one handed and has no chance. Brendan st away from him, not wanting to hurt his brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? It's over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank screams at Brendan from cageside to take the wounde Tommy out, but Brendan is reluctant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over, Tommy. C'mon. We don't have to do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy and Brendan circle each other. Tommy throwing right and wincing in agony at any movement. Brendan stares at h Everything about him says "Quit, Tommy." But Tommy won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy runs up the tunnel, his All Access pass around his neck, and enters the arena. Sees Brendan and Tommy in the cage. Quickly figures out what the situation is. 101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zito and the kids staring at the screen, imploring Brenda take the helpless Tommy out and win the championship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan continues to circle and not engage. Frank is livi He knows he'll lose the fight on the judges' scorecards i doesn't do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finish him! You finish him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy keeps throwing defiant right jabs at Brendan. Final with no choice, Brendan fires back. He batters the defenseless Tommy up against the cage and POUNDS away at blasting his left shoulder with punches that make Tommy w in pain. It's anyone's guess how he can take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan presses his brother up against the cage. Begging to quit. But Tommy merely responds by elbowing Brendan in face again. This sets the older brother off, and he resum pounding on Tommy until the HORN sounds and Rosenthal pul Brendan away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Break! Break!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan heads back to his stool as Tommy leans against th cage in agony. The Marines scream for him, but his eyes a glazed over. It's unthinkable that he hasn't broken yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From near cageside, Paddy looks to the corner and makes e contact with Brendan. They exchange a small look of understanding. A NOD. They both know what needs to be don

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd wants a victory. Tito and the boys start the "M ter C!" chant again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy and Brendan stand for Round Five. Tommy's face is battered after Round Four and Brendan's face is ruined. 102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the crowd, the "Tommy" CHANT begins in earnest. In fac it may be louder than ever. Having done the impossible an carried on with one arm, Tommy is more superhuman and her than ever before. But his face tells another story. Soake pain and anguish. All his stoic walls crumbling down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes riveted to the screen, where the brothers circle each other as in the fourth round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan SLAMS Tommy to the ground. His face is contorted merciless pain. Brendan slips his forearm under Tommy's n and squeezes. Tommy struggles, but he's got one arm and there's NO ESCAPE. His face getting red from lack of oxyg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As an anguished Tess and a shaken Paddy look on, Brendan CHOKES his brother. As he does, he pleads with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Tommy! I'm sorry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy continues to struggle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tap, Tommy! Tap!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears pour down Tommy's face. Brendan is crushing his win pipe. Tommy's eyes bulge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Tommy! I love you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy, about to pass out, no more air to breathe, slowly opens his left hand, looks at Brendan, and TAPS his shoul on the Conlon family crest. Finally submitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While most of the crowd erupts in celebration and the kid leap into each other's arms, Joe Zito stares at the scree

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank makes eye contact with the jubilant Tess. Indicates should meet them in the locker room. Meanwhile, people po into the cage. Frank pushes them aside, keeping them away from Brendan and Tommy, who remain on the ground, exhaust Tommy to begins to WEEP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence at Colt's. Everyone spent from what they've seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy buries his head in Brendan's chest. A torrent of sobbing gushes from him, years of pain pouring out in hea bursts. From the crowd, Paddy stares into the cage and watches as Brendan comforts his little brother, then help him to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Callen, Sheridan, and J.J. Riley make their way inside fo the post-fight interview, cameras trailing behind them. W Frank continuing to run interference, Brendan pushes thro the crush of people, arm around Tommy, and exits the cage

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd parts for Tommy and Brendan. Paddy watches them tear in his eye. He's overwhelmed by the sight of his two boys together again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the noise from the arena fades, the brothers walk thro the wild crowd and continue on through the tunnel, arm in arm...
